tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Anhs Brush With Fame
programme.desc: Comedian and artist Anh Do paints controversial, outspoken and passionate athlete, Anthony Mundine. Anthony talks about what drives him and what makes him tick. (Final)

programme.title: The Art Of Starting Over
programme.desc: How do we start over when life takes us back to square one? Guest host Osher Gunsberg seeks answers from ex-Wiggle Emma Watkins, AFL legend turned painter Gavin Wanganeen and comedian Sam Kissajukian.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: Endeavour persists undeterred with the investigation at Blenheim Vale, before the death of a uniformed copper sends shockwaves through Castle Gate.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: Dale and Michael embark on a project to restore two 19th Century timber cottages on their Tasmanian rural property. Will they accomplish their dream?

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow goes to one of the grandest, historic houses in Wales, Powis Castle.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Who will accept the Big Brass Mug from Tom Gleeson... and who will be sent OUT!? On the Hard Quiz podiums are self-nominated experts in Kate Bush, Bratz dolls, Kakadu National Park and The Goodies!

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: In her first in-depth interview since her fathers death, former tennis star Jelena Dokic opens up about the years of abuse she suffered at his hands and how she rebuilt her life.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Australias leading forum for media analysis and comment. Host Linton Besser, a four-time Walkley award-winning investigative reporter and former foreign correspondent, brings you a fearless critique of the weeks journalism.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: Black Saturday Bushfires. Saturday 7 February 2009. I Was Actually There collects personal stories from survivors, first responders and community members who faced the catastrophe.

programme.title: Creative Types With Virginia Trioli
programme.desc: Award-winning broadcaster Virginia Trioli explores the essence of creativity with some of our best loved artists at the peak of their powers. Virginias first guest is literary sensation Trent Dalton.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Elinor and Born Barikor build a hypoallergenic home to alleviate their two young sons life threatening allergies. Their home is built with low toxin materials and cutting edge filtration systems to purify the air.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa Georgiadis visits a plantsmans garden; Tino Carnevale and Millie Ross try some unusual vegie-growing containers; Josh Byrne shows how a storm drain became a park and Sophie Thomson gives an overview of her garden.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Chas and John unpack the events making news in America over the weekend including the start of a ceasefire in Gaza, Trump goes to Egypt and Israel for the signing of a deal, and the US government shutdown continues.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: The 1960s introduced us to shag rugs, lava lamps, minimalism and bright, open spaces. Melbourne couple Laura and Reece are leaving inner Melbourne for suburbia, with plans to restore a modernist home to its former glory.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The roadshow comes from Clissold Park in Stoke Newington, London.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson hosts Australias favourite quiz show. Expert topics are Scooby-Doo, The Salvation Army, The Big Lebowski film and masked metal band, Slipknot. Only one winner can take home the Big Brass Mug!

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: How did it feel to watch from the 92nd floor of the World Trade Center, as the first 9/11 plane hit the building opposite?

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the story with the latest on the days events, explaining whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe uncovering what you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Donald Trump has long boasted of his wealth, is he now using his office to enrich himself and his family? John Lyons examines Trumps vast network of foreign deals, hotels and crypto, and accusations of conflicts of interest.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors look at your kidneys and reveal how these amazing cleaning machines work, the Ouch-Mobile is open for more intriguing medical mysteries and Dr Xand tries out some vision-shifting spectacles.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: To recover a missing package, the Bears get help from Ranger Tabes, an eccentric forest ranger. But her overblown sense of justice might be too much for the Bears to handle.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Shadow Moth creates Sentibubbler, a fearsome Sentimonster that will only stop if Rena Rouge betrays Ladybug and Cat Noir! Will our heroes pass this trust test?

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Starfires new pet is a horribly dangerous parasite.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Two alien kids land at the farm one night and run riot. Can Shaun and Bitzer stop them before they wake the Farmer?

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides a group of medical students through the game - but will the pressure of the mighty maze turn their bright minds to mush?

programme.title: Mythbusters: Theres Your Problem!
programme.desc: Delving into the science of animal behaviour, the MythBusters kick off this episode with a risky romp into a crocodile pit.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors find out what happens when you eat with the help of a miniature Xand doll, test your ears and eyes in a baffling mind-bending trick, and join Dr Chris at work fighting infectious diseases.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears switch bedrooms for the night and get a glimpse of the living space of one of their brothers. But the deeper they go, hidden secrets are revealed.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Unable to declare her love to Adrien, Marinette turns to Cat Noir to help her rehearse. But their closeness is not to everyones liking, starting with Glaciator.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Beast Boy teaches Starfire how to lie and it backfires.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A bored Shaun dresses up as the Farmer to entertain the flock. Realising he now has the power to boss Bitzer around Shaun takes the opportunity to throw a bit of a party for the flock.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Chris makes Dr Xand cry to demonstrate how your amazing body makes different types of tears to protect your eyes in different ways, and in Operation Takeover they discover just how dangerous it can be out at sea.

programme.title: Expedition With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve takes on four entirely new adventures to some of the remotest parts in search of precious natural wonders. He unearths secrets of an ancient civilisation and discovers wildlife more at risk than ever before.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Nick Cave and Warren Ellis At Hanging Rock
programme.desc: Featuring new and classic songs, this epic live show celebrates the profound relationship that Australian music legends Nick Cave and Warren Ellis have developed with their audience over four decades.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Its the day of Addies performance, but theres even more drama behind the scenes as Emilys jealousy reaches breaking point. With Maggie in prison, Elinor plans a daring rescue.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: This Is All The Power Ive Got! A Settlement Between Gods
programme.desc: Goku continues the hard fought battle, but his powers still arent enough to take down the God of Destruction. When his energy finally runs out, Earths fate is sealed! Or is it? The battle of the gods reaches its end!

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Haunted by the memory of his recently departed pet, Pierce suspects it may be responsible for ghostly activity in the walls of Helsings house.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Rosemary Riddle
programme.desc: Ezra is grumpy when his visiting Nanna interrupts his detective work until she unexpectedly gives the Inbestigators a case to crack.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When the beach is taken over by the most excellent Bro Sharks, will the Girls be gnarly enough to save the day?

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy meets the kids at the beach to explore rock pools and see the plants and animals that live in them. The team use jars to collect water and bits of seaweed from the ocean and observe the plankton and microorganisms.

programme.title: Mini Lessons
programme.desc: In this lesson, you will learn about probability using percentages and decimals. Ms Szalek explains percentages, and then she explains how to convert expected and actual probability outcomes into decimals.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets a cheese salesman transforming a horse trailer into a cheese stall, and a man hoping to set a world record for the smallest campervan. Finally, Georges garden build is revealed. (Final)

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The series celebrating ingenious small space builds returns. George meets a couple who bought the wreck of a private jet and a gypsy tattoo artist who hopes to turn an old railway carriage into a home.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Hollie England, Giancarlo Scalia, Francis Menotti and Gabriel Werlen.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Baker Boy
programme.desc: Celebrating the release of his brand-new album DJANDJAY, Baker Boy guest programs rage with his favourite music videos.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: After waking to find she has gained weight, Edina becomes obsessed with dieting, which is only exacerbated when she finds out an old, ever thin, nemesis intends to pay her a visit.

programme.title: A Kind Of Spark
programme.desc: Keedie is in burnout after the drama at school. Can Addie help her and find out what happened in Miss Murphys office all those years ago. Can Frank and Nina find a lost tortoise?

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Valiant Hercule, Work A Miracle! A Challenge From Outer Space
programme.desc: With Beerus gone and the world at peace once more, the Z Fighters resume their normal lives. But nothing ever remains calm, as aliens arrive on Earth to thank and challenge the hero who fought Beerus.

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Charlies stuck walking Wolfman instead of going to a party. He irresponsibly ditches Wolfman, but a little scratch on his neck could spell disaster.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Robot Robbery
programme.desc: On Science and Technology dress-up day, Patrick is upset when his robot costume is stolen by an unidentified mad professor.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Feeling inadequate as a superhero, Buttercup bulks up... to the max.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Clarence and the kids learn all about regenerative farming and treat the soil to a pampering session. Then they create their own day spa to treat themselves.

programme.title: BTN
programme.desc: BTN is a high-energy, fun way for Upper Primary and Secondary students to learn about current issues and events in their world. Each program is built around major news stories of the week.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil helps divorcees Sylvia and Bill sell their semi thats been loitering on the market for over a year. After 54 years of marriage theyve decided to separate, sell their home, and move on.

programme.title: Austin
programme.desc: Julian is dropped from Big Bears TV deal due to his "reputation", while Ingrid is named creative lead. Austin searches for a British backstory worthy of a book deal.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, each of the friends decides to give Lily Plant some pretend water. Everybody loves Lily Plant, Lily Plant loves pretend water, what a lovely day for Lily Plant!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: After forgetting Maes birthday, the villagers join forces to throw her a surprise party for the ages with some help from a very unreliable Russell.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Jango pretends to be a genie and grants Bop a wish in exchange for a basket of apples, but how is Jango going to make Bops wish come true?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector finds a lost teddy bear, and tries to help.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Cocos Hula Hoop. Its harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig and Granny Pig are taking Peppa, George and their friends on a boat trip to Pirate Island. Grandpa uses his metal detector to find treasure and they all build a big sandcastle. The children love Pirate Island.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When Shauns old friend the Alien drops by for a loo break, Shaun is only too happy to let him use the facilities in the farmhouse. While hes going about his business he leaves Shaun in charge of his intriguing new gadget.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Which team will win Malcolms Wildlife Photo Challenge - Mandy and Mike, Sarah and James, Hannah and Joe, or Norman and Jodie?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly takes some frogspawn home from class to look after, but is surprised when the frogspawn has turned into tadpoles by morning. Soon there are lots of little frogs for Holly to look after!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: There is a new friend for Peppa at her playgroup, Lotte Lama. She can speak a foreign language. Peppa loves talking, everyone loves talking!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma tries to impress her zoologist hero when dinosaur bones are discovered on Kangaroo Beach. But what sort of dinosaur do they belong to?

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Frankie and friends help Mr. Mash conquer stage fright with teamwork, creating a magical and memorable talent show.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Anniversary
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay try to help Appa and Amma surprise each other for the anniversary of their first date, things quickly get out of hand!

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie, Nina and Akil go to the woods to make a den. They learn about planning a project and the teamwork to make it happen.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can you create swirling patterns on liquid surfaces? In this experiment, Alex uses dish soap, food dye and milk to create some swirly-twirly art.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Hey, diddle diddle! Its pandemonium at the Alphablocks animal sing-song. This episode has fun with the words cat, dog, cod, tag, jog, jig, mop, moo, moon, spoon and zoom.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.sub-title: The Biggest Muddy Puddle In The World
programme.desc: Peppa and George wake up one morning to find that all the rain has made a flood, and their house is now a desert island!

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Miles loses his Rowdy Robot toy during a trip to the park, its up to Millie to find it!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Fifi asks Stanley to help them find a Mermaid so they can take its picture for school. With the help of Little Woo, the explore in Stanleys new submarine in search for the illusive Mermaid

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Gemma tries to impress her zoologist hero when dinosaur bones are discovered on Kangaroo Beach. But what sort of dinosaur do they belong to?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sonny is trying to prove himself to be a useful engine so that he can stay working on Sodor, but nobody seems to trust him... nobody apart from Diesel, that is! But can Diesel be trusted?

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the junior gardeners make pots so magical; they disappear into the garden!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Explore music from around the world and learn with The Wiggles! Visit Athens with Lucia, travel to the Philippines with John, and stop by Ethiopia with Tsehay!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Drac struggles to learn a new dance routine but, with the Super Monsters support, learns its okay to make mistakes and that persistence leads to success.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to visit a house that Mr Bull is building. Who will their new neighbours be?

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Robot wants to be a "hero robot" and "stop Romeo". Gekko decides to help him by training him but what sort of hero will he make Robot be?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington accidentally destroys a squirrels nut store so invites him in to apologise, however he didnt expect him to bring friends.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato, Carrot and Tomato are exploring in the plant aisle when they hear a strange noise. They follow the noise and meet the famous Kiwi the Explorer, who needs their help.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey plays mum to a brood of bouncy balloons, including an irrepressible floater named Greenie. But she soon discovers that mothering is much harder than she imagined.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion looks inside a book and decides to tell a story to his best friend Dibillo. Everybody enjoys watching the story come to life, especially when Mr Onion makes sure all of his friends are in it!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Mort creates a mysterious invention that no one knows quite what to do with. As they all play with it Beep learns about winning and the power of imagination.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Squidgie and Jango make a treasure hunt for their friends but after three tries with three different leaders they still havent found the treasure! What are they going to do?

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Moles pot plant has outgrown the house - where can it go?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George love jumping in muddy puddles, even when its raining - but when George takes off his rain hat, he catches a cold. After plenty of rest and some warm milk and honey, George is feeling much better.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its Timmys birthday and the Flock have thrown a party for him. At first hes delighted by all the attention; but when the Flock become distracted and hes left with no-one to play with, he decides to entertain himself.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Which team will win Malcolms Wildlife Photo Challenge - Mandy and Mike, Sarah and James, Hannah and Joe, or Norman and Jodie?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: The children are at the Elf Farm, but to learn where milk comes from they must visit a Big Farm, to find cows. They travel to Lucy Bigs Farm, where she shows them all the animals.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends are introduced to some simple woodcraft in the woods with Mr. Wolf.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its Spykes first day of training with the cadets on Kangaroo Beach and shes so excited to jump into all the action that she forgets to pay attention in class - learning the hard way that safety always comes first!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters learn empathy and kindness while bringing Doyle, the runaway gargoyle, back home.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Best Wedding
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay realise their parents had two weddings before they were born, they decide to plan them another wedding; the best wedding!

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Nina has hurt her arm and is feeling Fed up. Eddie and Akil team up to put on some special activities to cheer up their friend.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why dont some liquids mix? Michelle is glowing with excitement as she creates her own wibbly wobbly lava lamp! Discover why liquids such as oil and water dont mix together in this fun and bubbly experiment.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: D is ready to rock - he has his drumsticks but nothing to bang on. This episode introduces the letter D and the words sat, pad, pan, pin, tap and din.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig takes Peppa and George to visit a house that Mr Bull is building. Who will their new neighbours be?

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Millie, Ben and Maya get carried away with their school project when they decide to build a scale model of the solar system.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Cynthia is working on the bus so asks Stanley to take her passengers to the Community centre. Seamus, Little Woo, Fred and Fifi are going to play football and have a lot of equipment.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.sub-title: The Power Of Mystery Mountain Part 2
programme.desc: The story continues, after Mystery Mountain breaks out of its dimension and floats over the city.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its Spykes first day of training with the cadets on Kangaroo Beach and shes so excited to jump into all the action that she forgets to pay attention in class - learning the hard way that safety always comes first!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps Ruth fix up an old windmill into her new, energy-efficient workshop.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and Molly learn about different miniclimates in the garden and even create their own - a terrarium!

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join The Wiggles for a musical adventure exploring emotions! Sing along to Skidamarink and Whenever I Hear This Music, and explore how music makes us feel with Lachy and Dorothy the Dinosaur!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Frankie borrows Katyas wand, bringing carousel horses to life. The Super Monsters unite to corral the ponies, while Katya restores the wand in this fun-filled adventure!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mr Zebra delivers a parcel for Peppa and George from their Auntie Dottie. What could it be?

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Owlette and Gekko dont listen to Icecubs knowledge, neither do the Wolfies,

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Judy gets a Toy Spy Kit, but why is Mrs. Bird being so secretive? Theres only one way to find out lets follow her!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mr Elf is overworked so King Thistle sentences him to a holiday. He isnt too pleased. Mrs Elf and Ben however are overjoyed at the news. Meanwhile Nanny takes over the food deliveries.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: When a wormhole opens in Tree House Mission Command, Chip walks through into an Alien World across the Galaxy and returns with a six-legged alien bunny. With the wormhole closed, how will they get this strange bunny home?

programme.title: Anhs Brush With Fame
programme.desc: Comedian and artist Anh Do paints controversial, outspoken and passionate athlete, Anthony Mundine. Anthony talks about what drives him and what makes him tick. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: Offsiders
programme.desc: Abbey Gelmi and the panel Gideon Haigh, Rana Hussain and Daniel Cherny discuss the Womens ODI World Cup, the build up to the Ashes and the latest AFLW news.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Hundreds of court cases including child abuse and sexual offences under review as police examine work by an officer in regional Victoria. Plus drought-stricken SA hit with a potato shortage leaving supermarket shelves bare.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As each day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. Bridget Brennan and James Glenday present the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, joined by Emma Rebellato, Catherine Murphy and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Melissa Mackay brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to cover whats happening and why it matters. Melissa Mackay brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Joe OBrien brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days top stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Chas and John unpack the events making news in America over the weekend including the start of a ceasefire in Gaza, Trump goes to Egypt and Israel for the signing of a deal, and the US government shutdown continues.
Suburbs under siege - shocking crimes leaving residents exposed. 7.30 investigates the spate of home break-ins and car thefts.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong with the news from Asia: At least 19 children die after consuming toxic cough syrup in India, hundreds of trekkers rescued from a blizzard on the Tibetan side of Mt Everest, plus Japan set for its first woman PM.

programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Donald Trump has long boasted of his wealth, is he now using his office to enrich himself and his family? John Lyons examines Trumps vast network of foreign deals, hotels and crypto, and accusations of conflicts of interest.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.
